page.title: 19RECREATION
page.content: On the basis of interviewing young adults in the age group of eighteen to twenty one, the main form of recreation appeared to be visiting public houses and various social clubs i.e. working mens clubs, and political clubs. Other interests were shown to be sporting, swimming, football, rugby, snooker,pool and jogging. Among this age group there were many who were unemployed and these people obviously had more leisure time than people who were employed. Adults in the 21+ age bracket gave the following leisure activities, family outings, jogging, gardening, cars, reading, walking, wine making, television and video films, golf, cricket and playing darts. In this age group the interests were less regularly followed and the reason given was family committments and demands of work.
